Classes/NKElement.html.name: NKElement

Classes/NKImagesElement.html.name: NKImagesElement
Classes/NKImagesElement.html.abstract: This class represents a Nooko images element.

Classes/NKMediaElement.html.name: NKMediaElement
Classes/NKMediaElement.html.abstract: This class represents a Nooko media element.

Classes/NKAddressElement.html.abstract: This class represents a Nooko address element.

Classes/NKDropdownElement.html.name: NKDropdownElement
Classes/NKDropdownElement.html.abstract: This class represents a Nooko dropdown element.

Classes/NKDropdownElementOption.html.name: NKDropdownElementOption

Classes/NKSection.html#/c:objc(cs)NKSect.name: elements

Classes/NKSection.html#/c:objc(cs)NKSect.name: -mapElementsToObject:withMapping:
Classes/NKSection.html#/c:objc(cs)NKSect.abstract: Copy a set of elements values from this Entry to a custom object. This is very useful if you want to initialize a custom object you created with the values of the elements of this section. The properties of elements can be queried with the dot notation, e.g. image.firstImage.url, if no property is queried the object mapped is the value of the element, for example if it’s a NKTextElement it will map the string value.

Classes/NKClient.html.name: NKClient
